Key Match Events: Trent Boult took 3 wickets for 37 runs
Devon Conway and Rachin Ravindra added 86 runs for the opening wicket
Daryl Mitchell scored 43 off 31 balls including 5 fours and 2 sixes
Dushmantha Chameera conceded 20 runs in 4 overs
Asalanka took a diving catch to dismiss Daryl Mitchell
Post-Match Reflections: Kane Williamson said the team knew Sri Lanka could be strong and the wickets picked up went a long way in restricting them
Kusal Mendis expressed disappointment with his own performance but was happy to see young players stepping up
Trent Boult said it was a must-win game and a nice success at the top
Rachin Ravindra said it was a surreal feeling and he dreams of playing in Bangalore
Trent Boult's performance led New Zealand into the semi-finals
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand won by 5 wickets with 160 balls remaining
Sri Lanka's batting struggled in the initial overs losing three-four wickets
Sri Lanka's bowling could not restrict New Zealand despite Dilshan Madushanka's good performance
New Zealand's positive NRR gives them a high chance of playing India in the semi-final in Mumbai
